title: Trireme
summary: A trireme (/ˈtraɪriːm/, TRY-reem; derived from Latin: trirēmis[1] "with three banks of oars"; 'triērēs,[2] literally "three-rower") was an ancient vessel and a type of galley that was used by the ancient maritime civilizations of the Mediterranean Sea, especially the Phoenicians, ancient Greeks and Romans.[3][4]
